name: Alpepine
plantInfo: The Alpepine is an evergreen tree belonging to the Pinaceae family of European mountain ranges. Cultivated for the most part in Italy and Austria often reaches a height of 15-20 m with woody bark at the base; needles collected in bunches of 5.
effect: Revitalise; Supports airways; Supports immunesystem; Purifying Pine Cembro is mainly used for its expectorant qualities and for the treatment of respiratory illnesses.
Harmonzes: Cypress; Elemi; Juniper; Lavender; Lavandin; Ravintsar; Rosemary Verbenone; Ylang-Ylang and spicy oils and citrus fruits.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Do not ingest and do not use pure on the skin; causing skin irritation

name: Balsamfir
plantInfo: The balsamfir is a an evergreen tree belonging to the Pinaceae family. Cultivated for the most part in Canada and USA often reaches a height of 20 m. On the bark and leafs; blisters form full of resin and essential oils called Canadian Balm
effect: Antibacterial; sooths the airways. Relaxing; purifying and bring emotional balance. Eases tired muscles
Harmonzes: Pine; fir; juniper; west-indian sandalwood; benzoin
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Can cause nausea in high concentration. Do not use during pregnancy

name: Basil
plantInfo: Tropical basil (Ocimum Basilicum) is an annual herb plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family of the tropical regions of Asia and Africa. Cultivated mostly in France and Italy reaches a height of 60 cm with erect stem; green oval leaves and white-rose flowers.
effect: Revitalise. Clears mucous in upper airways and recoveres our sense of smell. Stimulates the bloodflow to the brains; improves concentration and clears mind. musclepain;  relaxes cramps
Harmonzes: Cypress; bergamot; rosewood; howood; geranium; litsea; sage; spice oils
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Use with moderation. It is preferable to avoid using it during pregnancy

name: Bee balm
plantInfo: Bee balm is a perennial herb plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family of North America. It grows spontaneously for the most part in Canada; the United States and Mexico; often reaches a height of about 1 m; has gray-green leaves and highly scented purple-rosace flowers.
effect: Revitalise; Purifying; antiviral; anti-infectious; broad spectrum antibacterial and antifungal.
Harmonzes: Roman Camomiles; Cypress; Patchouli; Rose; Geranium; lavender; Ylang-Ylang Petit grain Mandarine; and citrus oils.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: It is preferable to avoid using it during pregnancy

name: Benzoe
plantInfo: Benzoin (Styrax Benzoin) is a plant belonging to the Styracaceae family of Indonesia. Grown spontaneously for the most part in Vietnam; Cambodia; China and Thailand; it often reaches a height of 20 m with sloping bases covered by a gray bark from which emerges the precious resin and oval leaves; the darker on the top and covered with a slight whitish hair at the bottom. The flowers are yellowish outside and reddish inside. The fruit is a berry.
effect: Relaxing; Supports airways; Purifying; expectorant; calming; strongly skinregenerating; dry skin
Harmonzes: Amyris; Copal; Ginger; Jasmin; Geranium; Korander; Cinnamon; Lavender; Lavandin; Lemon; Marjoram; Neroli; Black Pepper; Rosemary and citrus oils.
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Use in moderation; Slightly toxic; Difficult to use due to its thinkness

name: Bergamot
plantInfo: Bergamot (Citrus Bergamia) is a tree belonging to the Rutaceae family; originating in tropical Asia. Cultivated for the most part in Italy and Côte d'Ivoire reaches a height of 5 m with woody bases; oval smooth dark green leaves; green and rounded fruits that become yellow with maturation.
effect: Relaxing; Harmonizing; Purifying; lightly anti-bacterial; calms down the mind and sets a positive energetic spirit; skinregenerating and woundhealing
Harmonzes: Cypress; Coriander; Geranium; juniper; Litsea; Myrrh; Neroli; Patchouli; Spices
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Photosensibilizing and phototoxic; not to be used before exposure to the sun!

name: Bergamotmint
plantInfo: Mentha citrata is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family of Europe and some regions of Asia. It’s also called the bermamotmint because of its leafs smelling alot like the bergamotfruit. It contains no menthol.
effect: antivral and strongly immunestimmulating; Calms your breathing and emotions but revitalizes your mind; skincare and revitalisating
Harmonzes: Lavender; Lavandin; Ho; Geranium; Ylang Ylang; Eucalyptus; Rosemary; Citrusses
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Can be toxic in high concentration. Do not use during pregnancy.

name: Bloodorange
plantInfo: Bloodorange (Citrus Sinensis) is an evergreen tree; belonging to the Rutaceae family of China. Cultivated for the most part in Italy and Spain reaches a height of 8-10 m with woody base; small green-dark leaves and clear whitish flowers. The fruits are larger and clearer than those of the bitter orange.
effect: Relaxing; Harmonizing; Purifying; disinfects the air; supports when having a cold or bronchitis; uplifts and relaxing when having stress; firms the skintension
Harmonzes: Star Anise; Cinnamon; Cloves; Lavender; Lavandin; Myrhh; Vanilla and most of the existing oils
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Photosensibilizing and phototoxic; not to be used before exposure to the sun.

name: Cabreuva
plantInfo: Cabreuva is a tropical tree belonging to the Fabacea family and cultivated for the most part in Paraguay; Argentina; Brazil.
effect: Antisceptic; stimulates the immunesystem and sooths breathing; Aphrodisiac for men; revitalizes and clears the mind; Skinregenerating
Harmonzes: Ceder; Rose; Geranium; Lavender; Palmarosa; Lavandin; Conifers
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Do not use purly on skin

name: Cadetar
plantInfo: Cade or Pirky juniper is an evergreen bush with big blackbrown berrys and long green needles belonging to the Cupressaceae family and originates from South-France
effect: Fragrance; skin; Calming and harmonizing; Skinregeneration; antibacterial; antifungal; dandruff
CONTRAINDICATIONS: It’s all about the dosage DOSE LOW! Only one or 2 drops is enough! Toxic in high concentration. Do not use during pregnancy; Can cause allergic reaction on skin

name: Cajeput
plantInfo: The Cajeput (Melaleuca Cajeputi) is a large evergreen tree belonging to the family of the Myrtaceae native to Malaysia. Cultivated mostly in Vietnam; Indonesia and Australia often reaches a height of 30 m with thick leaves and white flowers.
effect: Revitalise; Supports airways; Purifying; Excellent for supporting the airways; flu and and a great expectorant. It is THE oil for dry coughs; Clears the mind and improves concentration; Calms down strong emotions; Disinfecting; Sooths inflammation of muscles; acne
Harmonzes: Cedar; Lavender; Lime; Marjoram; Thymian; Tea tree; Cypress; Juniper and Citrus oils
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Use with moderation

name: Camomile
plantInfo: The Matricaria recutita is herb belonging to the Asteraceae family; Cultivad most part in Hungary; France and Egypt it grows up to 60cm
effect: Relaxing; Harmonizing; immunestimmulating (white bloodcells); neutralizes toxic bacteria; calms the mind( acne; rosacea; dermatitis; eczema)
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Could cause allergic reaction when used beging allergic to composite flowers

name: Camphor
plantInfo: Camphor is an evergreen plant belonging to the Lauraceae family of Eastern Asia. It grows mostly in China; Japan and Taiwan; often reaches a height of 40 m with rather thin base from which the camphor is extracted by steam stream and then refined through the sublimation process. The leaves are lanceolate; groovy; thick and persistent with White flowers and black drupa fruit
effect: Harmonizing; Revitalise; Supports airways; Excellent support for bronchitis; Stimulating; a true tonic for the nerve system; lightly narcotic; stimulates bloodcirculation
Harmonzes: Basil; Benzoin; Cajeput; Chamomile; Rosemary; Pine; Cardamom; Cinnamon; Citronella; Elemi; Lavender; Lavendin; Ho; Lemon; Neroli and Citrus oils
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Use in moderation. Do not ingest or use pure skin; scratches or wounds. Pregnancy is not recommended.

name: Cardamom
plantInfo: Cardamom (Elettaria Cardamomum) is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Zingiberaceae family of Asian Tropical origin. Cultured for the most part in India; Sri Lanka and Laos often reach a height of 4 m with long silky saber leaves; long stems carry small flowers.
effect: Harmonizing; Revitalise; Supports airways; Purifying; Expectorant; sooths coughing & bronchitis; warming; Refreshing and strengths the mind; relaxes the muscles; lightly aphrodisiac
Harmonzes: Sweet Orange; Bergamot; Cinnamon; Cedar; Cloves; Elemi; Star Anis; Lime; Ylang-Ylang and citrus oils
CONTRAINDICATIONS: It is allergic and sensitizing

plantInfo: Revitalise; Purifying;

name: Cedar Atlas
plantInfo: Atlantic Cedar (Cedrus Atlantica) is an evergreen tree belonging to the Pinaceae family of Algeria. Cultivated for the most part in Morocco it often reaches a height of 40 m with woody bases at the base; pyramidal shape; majestic livery and light green leaves
effect: Relaxing; Supports airways; Purifying; Supports airways;  removes old stuck mucous; purifying; warming; calming; warming; calming
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Do not use during pregnancy

name: Cedar Himalaya
plantInfo: The Himalayan cedar  (Cedrus Deodara) is an evergreen plant belonging to the Pinaceae family originally from the western side of the Himalayas. It grows mostly in India; Afghanistan; Tibet and Nepal; often reaches a height of 40 m with rather large bulks at the base with pendulum branches. The leaves are needle-shaped; softer and longer than those of other cedars
effect: Relaxing; Supports airways; Purifying; Supports airways; removes old stuck mucous; warming; calming; Tonic for lymphatic system (cellulite!); stimulates immunesystem
Harmonzes: Benzoin; Bergamot; Cypress; Jasmine; Juniper; Rosemary; Ylang-Ylang and Citrus oils
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Do not use during pregnancy

name: Ceder Virginie
plantInfo: Virginia Cedar (Juniperus Virginiana) is a majestic evergreen tree belonging to the Cupressaceae family of North America. Cultivated for the most part in North America and Canada often reaches a height of 35 m with woody bases at the base; lightheaded and light green cone. Plant also known as Virginia's Jungle
effect: Relaxing; Supports airways; removes old stuck mucous; purifying; warming; calming; Tonic for lymphatic system and vains; stimulates bloodcirculation
Harmonzes: Benzoin; Bergamot; Cypress; Jasmine; Juniper; Rosemary; Ylang-Ylang and Citrus oils

name: Cinnamom
plantInfo: Cinnamon (Cinnamomum Verum) is an evergreen tropical tree belonging to the Lauraceae family of Sri Lanka. Cultivated for the most part in Madagascar; it often reaches a height of 15 m with woody bases at the base; sturdy branches; thick bark and scabra; shiny green leaves and small white flowers
effect: Harmonizing; Supports airways; Supports immunesystem; Purifying; Strongly antibacterial; sooths airways; Stimulates immunesystem; Gives a warm cozy feeling; boost the spirit; true winteroil; Stimulates bloodcirculation; purifies
Harmonzes: Amyris; Star Anise; Lemongrass; Sweet Orange; Basil; Benzoin; Cajeput; Coriander; Sweet Fennel; Lavender; Lavendir; Red Mandarin; Ylang-Ylang and citrus oils
CONTRAINDICATIONS: Use with caution and dose very low! Cinnamon contains phenols and aldyhydes what can cause severe skin irritation if overdosed
